name: Momo Test Kitchen
address: Annex Bldg, 80 58th St, Brooklyn, NY 11220, USA

reviews.text: Great place. Fast service, good food, friendly workers, very gluten friendly.

I love this small Japanese cafe. It‚Äôs small but the atmosphere gives off comfy and friendly vibes. The food is amazing and portion size is superb. I love how it‚Äôs beginning to really get popular around the community especially with the NYU hospital around the corner. I advise if you want to take out to order online.

This hole-in-the-wall is a little difficult to find. It sits in what use to be the USA's largest supply depot. Now its basically a work location for for artists & manufacturers. Transportation wise, if you connect to the B11 bus, it's last stop will put you just 1 block away. The restaurant itself is very small with just a counterspace that will accomodate 8-9 people. What's really cool is that you can see the can kitchen staff busy preparing your meal. I had the bbq eel bowl & the eel avocado cucumber role, while my daughter had the salmon teriyaki bento box & spicy tuna role. They were all delicious & fresh tasting. There service was phenomenal & friendly. They also have some really tasty sauces. We had the ginger & spicy mayo. All in all it was worth the trip, just wish the place was bigger.
The edamame dip at the Park Slope Farmers Market(Sunday)was absolutely delicious! I ended up buying the Edamame Croquette, too. Can‚Äôt wait to dine in at their restaurant soon!

This place is such a hidden gem.
I tried their omakase sushi combo today and it was excellent.
‚Ä¢	The uni was fresh and creamy, with a natural sweetness.
‚Ä¢	The albacore tuna was tender and lightly seared with yuzu salt ‚Äî a thoughtful touch.
‚Ä¢	The chutoro was rich and buttery, definitely the highlight of the set.
‚Ä¢	Yellowtail and sea bream were very fresh, each with a clean, distinct flavor.
‚Ä¢	The scallop was soft and slightly sweet, with a pleasant creamy finish.
‚Ä¢	The ikura was perfectly seasoned ‚Äî no extra soy sauce needed.
‚Ä¢	The BBQ eel had just the right amount of sauce and a gentle smoky aroma.

This meal really reminded me of what good sushi should taste like ‚Äî fresh, balanced, and full of care.
Looking forward to coming back and trying the future omakase.
nice
Little place, big punch. Ate with a colleague, great prices, only seating for maybe 6. Friendly staff, fast service, great food. People kept pouring in while we were there.
My favorite lunch spot in the Brooklyn Army Terminal area. Clean, fresh, quality, great-tasting  food served by the friendliest chef and staff.

A true hidden gem in Sunset Park. The restaurant is a little hard to find if you don't know where to look, but the food is well worth it. A great selection of Japanese entrees, sides and beverages expertly prepared. The sides change most days, so it is exciting to see what delicious food is on the menu each time you visit. The atmosphere is intimate and inviting and the staff are incredibly kind. Always a pleasure enjoying a meal here or taking it to go.

Excellent! Even better than expected. Cute little store run by a Japanese mom and pop. They were very friendly and happy, greeting me as I came in and left. Food was excellent- cooked with heart, very tasty home cooking and authentic, better than larger restaurants. We had the oyako don, karaage salad, futomaki, potato salad, and chicken katsudon- all were delicious. We will definitely be back and highly recommend.
Some of the freshest sushi you‚Äôll have in Brooklyn. The cooked food is comfort in a bowl.‚Ä¶

Got the chicken katsu curry and it‚Äôs very  filling and pick up after we called in was quick and staff friendly.
I toke it home the next day and left it in a fridge somewhere else and for a few moments I was so upset I wouldn‚Äôt be able to finish it because it was that good. I liked the side salad i got as well. Store was clean and bright I hope I can come again soon.
Hidden gem with superb food. Every dish is a safe bet. Their salads are outstanding!

The cashier was extremely rude. Not only did she not welcome us in she ignored us the entire time. We were clearly confused talking about looking at the menu wondering if we were to order first and then sit down or sit down and order first. While we were asking her and about to place our order she welcomed another party in who clearly knew how to order. They sat and then ordered  with familiarity. The whole time she just ignored us and glared at us. We were waiting to order and the entire time she was extremely rude and refused to repeat our order total. We paid cash and she didn‚Äôt even confirm our total and the amount we gave her or even ask us if we were taking it go. She did not thank us for the order and even gave attitude when I asked for the receipt. This place is located in the annex of the Brooklyn Army Terminal and I believe most customers are employees working in the area. The rest of the staff seemed nice and created a nice atmosphere. Expect for this cashier she handed me the food and didn‚Äôt even say thank you. I caught her glaring multiple times. Decent prices for the area, next time would definitely come and sit down to directly talk to the other staff. She was wearing a sweater from one of the high schools in Brooklyn, and honestly she was pretty rude to the next people in line too.
Amazing food, great prices, and nice staff!
Best Japanese food I ever had‚Ä¶ go try that‚Äôs all
The bestüòÆ‚Äçüí®ü§§
Spicy salmon hand roll special
This place is amazing!
Amazing gem of a place
Incredible food. Great prices. I wish this place were open later but if you can get there before 3, you won't regret it!

This place is a hidden gem! Amazing service, a wonderfully lit, fresh-feeling atmosphere, and absolutely delicious Japanese food. You can tell they love working here because they put that passion into everything they make. Highly recommend‚Äîbut let‚Äôs keep it our little secret! ü§´
Awesome. Good place
I'm a food delivery clerk. I'm waiting for my order here. The boss and staff are very enthusiastic. I feel very happy and the service is very good.
What an absolute treat. My takeout lunch from Momo Test Kitchen was delicious. I had the salmon bento box and a cookie to go. I look forward to eating here again. Thank you so much!

Holy wow. What a special spot. I got the vegetable curry, which came with a heap of dreamy fluffy rice, a sliced hard boiled egg, and a generous serving of perfectly spicy and savory vegetable curry. It was the perfect meal for a chilly fall day. I was in heaven. Then a slice of yuzu tart with little peaks of whipped cream. But above all, it was clear from every person who came in that this was a beloved place for everyone. Impeccable vibes and just stellar food. I'll be back as soon as humanly possible!
Tasty food, friendly service, perfect for lunch!
wow what a hidden gem. Such a cute but friendly family own take out place. Food was great, owners were so nice. Hidden gem right next to the ferry terminal!!

Delicious Karaage! A bit saltier than I'd like, and the ratio of rice to chicken is too high, but the chicken is cooked perfectly, and that's exceedingly rare at this price point.

Beef onigiri was also delicious, but same critiques: too salty, rice:beef ratio was too high

I love this place! Momo's Test Kitchen is hidden in the Brooklyn Army Terminal Annex but it is well worth the trip.

They serve a small selection of Japanese dishes like sushi, curry, noodles, and they have speciality meals on rotation like sandwiches and rice bowls.

The beauty of Momo's is the food is delicious. I think their sushi is the best in South Brooklyn, very spicy and loaded with rice. Their other dishes like curry and sandwiches are also the epitome of Japanese comfort food.

Prices are good but a little more than other places, but the quality of worth it. They also serve these yuzu drinks that are very delicious and they have an array of dressings and sauces to try.

A quaint but cozy little place. Food is pretty good and priced affordably and the selection is nice. Interior is clean and you are greeted and bid a good day... That's lovely! A nice little place that I think needs more attention!

I passed by this place so many times, but I‚Äôm so happy I finally caught it while it was open. I got the salmon bento box, and it was delicious! The sides blew it out of the park, with the lotus root being my favorite. Definitely worth it. The portions are a good size, making this such a gem. Definitely go check it out!

Okay, so New York‚Äôs best casual Japanese restaurant is hidden in a old World War I supply building. Stumbled on it while waiting for a ferry and it it was the highlight of my day. gorgeous katsu curry. wish I could have eaten more.
best place to get a quick, delicious meal that'll remind you of home. great service and prices.

This place I have gone to twice, and never disappoints. By far my favorite Japanese restaurant. My favorites are the Oyako Don, Onigiri (all of them), and Chicken Katsu Don. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!!

Ladies and gentlemen, this is literally THE BEST and THE MOST UNIQUE Japanese resturant in the entire South Brooklyn area. I have visited hundreds of Japanese or Asian resturants throughout my 17 years living in US or Brooklyn. As a food enthusiast i always value the restaurant's price and overall quality to find the definition of a great and low-key family style restaurant. This is the kind of asian restaurant you will be guaranteed to return for more. This is the restaurant will leaves a mark in your hard-working souls. Because this is the closest place where you can find authenic mom & pops foods (to a large extend) for the love of awesome Japanese foods! I had an easy 10/10, the best wholesome Japanese/Asian food experience ever have waited for a long period of time. And to the owner(s) of this restaurant, thank you to figure out such a textbook-like low-key cozy Japanese resturant and such a fun customer-oriented business model (will be a huge success follow this principle), the 1st ever seen in NY in my opinion.

Everything at Momo is absolutely fantastic. The salmon teriyaki bento box is to die for with a rotating selection of delicious homemade sides. I order lunch daily from here, and everything ‚Äî the sushi rolls, the rice bowls the sides, are all excellent. The staff is top notch This place has saved us all at lunchtime out at the Brooklyn army terminal.
So good! Great food. Comfortable pricing. Momo and her people are so welcoming.
Affordable lunch spot. Got the Karaage Bento. It's tiny though, recommend take out.

what a friendly bunch of people and delicious I mean DELICIOUS FOOD. We got a mix of things - soup of the day, karaage salad, chicken katsu bowl, and shrimp tempura roll. All very tasty and for a great price too. My personal standouts were the karaage salad and soup. The chicken karaage was juicy and flavorful. Perfectly seasoned. And not to mention all the ingredients in my salad tasted so fresh! The soup of the day was mushroom soup. There were pieces of bacon in it which added a nice smokey flavor. The interiors are cozy and momos is the perfect place to stop by for a quick bite. Or if you want to take your meal out to the pier and eat by the water‚Ä¶what a romantic day! We made our way out to the water after and it was the perfect day filled with delicious comforting foods :)

This place is the best! I‚Äôve had their chicken katsu curry and spam musubi. Solid flavors. I‚Äôm going to try their Kareage chicken next and then pretty much going through the entire menu after that! I‚Äôm so glad there‚Äôs finally some food options in this area!

This place is an amazing addition to the Brooklyn Army Terminal area.
Sushi is very fresh, miso soup is filling with seaweed and tofu. They baked their own cookies that are gluten free and delicious.
The peach Sorbet is a nice palate cleanser!
Highly recommend
Fresh and delicious food, every time! Wonderful staff, too. Highly recommended.
Simple, delicious homecooking. Try the BBQ eel bowl!
Always fresh food. Kind staff and simple atmosphere. Great lunch spot.

While you would never think to look for a place where it is and you walk in you feel like you walked into a restaurants kitchen instead of the actual restaurant.  However once you taste the food your mind is absolutely blown.  Once you get your food the smell alone is making your mouth water.  Then comes the actual taste and there is not enough words to describe it.  By far one of the best tasting meals I have had.  Connot wait to go back to try their other dishes.

We finally got a chance to visit Momo Test Kitchen on my Summer Friday since they are only open on weekdays.

We tried their dressing before and it was refreshing. Chef Momose was also the founder of MOMO dresssing.

We had their Vegetable Curry, Karaage Bento and Matcha White Chocolate Chip.
It‚Äôs overall decent with reasonable price.

The staffs are very friendly!!
Clean space!!
Of course they serve delicious Japanese comfort foodüòã
Amazing food, great customer service, and friendly atmosphere. Not too expensive either!

Walking to the ferry, from the distance I saw a sign on the side of the building, ‚ÄúJapanese food.‚Äù I didn‚Äôt think much of it just thought it was odd‚Äîlater to realize this authentic Japanese establishment existed!

The owner and staff are so kind and hospitable. Food is well made and fresh.

The chicken curry katsu was moist and comforting, and I loved the hint of sesame in the tuna sushi. The cream puff was structurally perfect and tasted delightful; it‚Äôs dense and super light and airy.

There are some seating to eat inside. I really like that they separated the curry from the rice/katsu for take out‚Äîpreserving freshness and preventing sogginess.

Small gem located in the Annex of the Brooklyn Army Terminal. Seating is limited but you can order take out and eat at the pier for a magnificent view of the waterfront. The curry is fragrant, delicious and freshly made. The chef and staff members are friendly and welcoming. Affordable prices for the quality of the meal!

Momo Test Kitchen is the absolute best place ever. I work at Brooklyn Army Terminal and we have been in desperate need of good food in the area. Everyone at Momo is kind and wonderful. The food is not just good, it's spectacular. You will not regret going out of your way to try this spot.

Doesn't get more authentic than this! Their options are ideal for anyone picking up a good lunch üòä or a to-go meal. They have vegetarian/vegan options too! You can even buy some delicious sauces by the bottle!
Great food, convenient location, hope they get expanded hours soon!

I think this is the best thing to happen to Bay Ridge/Sunset Park -- sushi, onigiri, rice bowls, Japanese potato salad, tons more and it's all üëè

Staff are sooooo nice and welcoming too. Perfect restaurant!

I wish I didn't have to write this review...
Authentic Japanese food.. Great price... Fast Service... Fills you up... please don't come here, this hidden gem is too good to share! ;)

If you want to eat "REAL" Japanese food, this is it!
Has large portions, good value with friendly chef:)
Food is delicious, staff are so nice, and prices are reasonable. Great lunch spot!!
